title: geth is stuck at "HTTP endpoint opened" on ubuntu but has no problems on Windows
body:
Hi there,
I am trying to synchronize blockchain data use geth.
But Geth is not stating to sync and has stucked at "HTTP endpoint opened" in Ubuntu but works well in Win10.
Can you give me some advice?

**System information**
geth1.8.0-stable
windows10 1909
ubuntu 18.04.5

**Reproducing the behavior in Ubuntu**
```cmd
geth --identity "ethsyn" --datadir "./block_data" --syncmode "fast" --rpc --rpcapi "db,eth,net,web3,personal,web3" --rpcaddr 127.0.0.1 --rpcport 8545 --rpccorsdomain "*" --cache=4096 --maxpeers 1000 --maxpendpeers 900
```

**Running Logs**
In Windows10
```log
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Maximum peer count                       ETH=1000 LES=0 total=1000
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/ethsynbysx/v1.8.0-stable-5f540757/windows-amd64/go1.9.2
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Allocated cache and file handles         database=***\block_data\\geth\\chaindata cache=3072 handles=1024
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 1 Homestead: 1150000 DAO: 1920000 DAOSupport: true EIP150: 2463000 EIP155: 2675000 EIP158: 2675000 Byzantium: 4370000 Engine: ethash}"
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Disk storage enabled for ethash caches   dir=***\\block_data\\geth\\ethash count=3
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=***\\AppData\\Ethash          count=2
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions="[63 62]" network=1
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Loaded most recent local header          number=3648 hash=381213…f1b99b td=171604616807611
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Loaded most recent local full block      number=0    hash=d4e567…cb8fa3 td=17179869184
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Loaded most recent local fast block      number=3266 hash=669de4…fb2b2f td=136832371205158
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Loaded local transaction journal         transactions=0 dropped=0
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [12-22|16:55:44] Starting P2P networking
INFO [12-22|16:55:46] UDP listener up                          self=enode://056fd8e8d2fd7bf487e00acbb56f98a72902461b98daac32a16cd6331d39729938f38a1aa51d301201fc463429a6cd07131a9f4aa11e5f9433b087ba65cd7eae@[::]:30303
INFO [12-22|16:55:46] RLPx listener up                         self=enode://056fd8e8d2fd7bf487e00acbb56f98a72902461b98daac32a16cd6331d39729938f38a1aa51d301201fc463429a6cd07131a9f4aa11e5f9433b087ba65cd7eae@[::]:30303
INFO [12-22|16:55:46] IPC endpoint opened                      url=\\\\.\\pipe\\geth.ipc
INFO [12-22|16:55:46] HTTP endpoint opened                     url=http://127.0.0.1:8545 cors=* hvosts=localhost
INFO [12-22|16:55:56] Block synchronisation started
INFO [12-22|16:55:56] Imported new block headers               count=0 elapsed=3.922ms number=3458 hash=aa5952…c099f2 ignored=192
INFO [12-22|16:56:02] Imported new state entries               count=273 elapsed=0s      processed=273 pending=4369 retry=0 duplicate=0 unexpected=0
...
```

In Ubuntu
```log
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Maximum peer count                       ETH=1000 LES=0 total=1000
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/ethsynbysx/v1.8.0-stable/linux-amd64/go1.13.4
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Allocated cache and file handles         database=***/block_data/geth/chaindata cache=3072 handles=512
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 1 Homestead: 1150000 DAO: 1920000 DAOSupport: true EIP150: 2463000 EIP155: 2675000 EIP158: 2675000 Byzantium: 4370000 Engine: ethash}"
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Disk storage enabled for ethash caches   dir=***/block_data/geth/ethash count=3
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=***/.ethash                count=2
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions="[63 62]" network=1
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Loaded most recent local header          number=0 hash=d4e567…cb8fa3 td=17179869184
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Loaded most recent local full block      number=0 hash=d4e567…cb8fa3 td=17179869184
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Loaded most recent local fast block      number=0 hash=d4e567…cb8fa3 td=17179869184
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Loaded local transaction journal         transactions=0 dropped=0
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [12-22|17:38:05] Starting P2P networking
INFO [12-22|17:38:07] UDP listener up                          self=enode://c1551eca66e027994f3361648a9c0026ba91219b4ad928ed3176c6d166bcba8807f68b142a5583acdeb1e4ae9b140a00349099ba223fd7d5efbb0bb52b487391@[::]:30303
INFO [12-22|17:38:07] RLPx listener up                         self=enode://c1551eca66e027994f3361648a9c0026ba91219b4ad928ed3176c6d166bcba8807f68b142a5583acdeb1e4ae9b140a00349099ba223fd7d5efbb0bb52b487391@[::]:30303
INFO [12-22|17:38:07] IPC endpoint opened                      url=***/block_data/geth.ipc
INFO [12-22|17:38:07] HTTP endpoint opened                     url=http://127.0.0.1:8545            cors=* hvosts=localhost
INFO [12-22|18:38:05] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
```

**tries**
I suspected it was the network port problem, so I tried to open port 30303 but nothing changed.
```cmd
iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 30303 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A INPUT -p udp --dport 30303 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A OUTPUT -p tcp --dport 30303 -j ACCEPT
iptables -A OUTPUT -p udp --dport 30303 -j ACCEPT
iptables-save
```
**AND** I have checked the firewall using
```cmd
sudo ufw status
```
and the status is *inactive*

> please also ope 30301 UDP

Thank you for your prompt reply, but the result does not change.(running 10 minutes)

This is my iptables information using `sudo iptables -L`
```log
Chain INPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination
ACCEPT     tcp  --  anywhere             anywhere             tcp dpt:30303
ACCEPT     udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp dpt:30303
ACCEPT     tcp  --  anywhere             anywhere             tcp dpt:30301
ACCEPT     udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp dpt:30301

Chain FORWARD (policy DROP)
target     prot opt source               destination

Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination
ACCEPT     tcp  --  anywhere             anywhere             tcp dpt:30303
ACCEPT     udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp dpt:30303
ACCEPT     tcp  --  anywhere             anywhere             tcp dpt:30301
ACCEPT     udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp dpt:30301
```

0

เมื่อ อ. 22 ธ.ค. 2020 เวลา 19:13 suxnju <notifications@github.com> เขียนว่า:

> 10 minutes)

> target     prot opt source               destination

> ACCEPT     udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp dpt:30303

Kantitad
Run with higher verbosity, should tell you more about what's going on.

> Run with higher verbosity, should tell you more about what's going on.

Thanks for your reply. I followed your suggestion , but did not find a solution. 
It seems to be doing one thing repeatedly after the message `HTTP endpoint opened`
```log
INFO [12-23|13:35:26] HTTP endpoint opened                     url=http://127.0.0.1:8545            cors=* hvosts=localhost
TRACE[12-23|13:35:26] >> FINDNODE/v4                           addr=13.93.211.84:30303  err=nil
...
TRACE[12-23|13:35:27] Bumping findnode failure counter         id=3f1d12044546b763 failcount=1
...
TRACE[12-23|13:35:27] >> FINDNODE/v4                           addr=52.74.57.123:30303  err=nil
...
DEBUG[12-23|13:35:41] Resolving node failed                    id=2806db39202b7f34 newdelay=2m0s
TRACE[12-23|13:35:41] New dial task                            task="staticdial 6ddc13a247e21d5d 52.211.229.165:30500"
TRACE[12-23|13:35:41] Dial task done                           task="staticdial 004f9b9b2a99ae1a 18.215.193.84:30303"
...
TRACE[12-23|13:35:41] Bumping findnode failure counter         id=78de8a0916848093 failcount=14
...
TRACE[12-23|13:35:56] Dial error                               task="staticdial 0b22f86745c88d0e 47.244.40.117:30303"   err="dial tcp 47.244.40.117:30303: i/o timeout"
...
TRACE[12-23|13:35:56] Starting bonding ping/pong               id=3f1d12044546b763 known=false failcount=4  age=446861h35m56.679614399s
TRACE[12-23|13:35:56] >> PING/v4                               addr=5.1.83.226:30303    err=nil
...
DEBUG[12-23|13:35:57] Resolving node failed                    id=59ee2b7d04b8a481 newdelay=2m0s
```
Please update your geth version and see if you still have the problem? Please reopen then. 1.8.0 is at least 3 years old
